channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Opposite 7 Lisson grove on pavement, 17th June
item.description:
Bin bags and first mile bags of rubbish bags dumped on pavement opposite 7 edward house Lisson grove need to clear out and fix it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lisson Grove, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken paving slabs all the way up and down the street, 17th June
item.description:
As previously stated - as far as we are aware, after 30 years of living in Whitehall Road, Bromley BR2 9SQ, the broken paving slabs have NEVER been replaced! For 30 years these have been getting worse and worse. They are now causing a trip hazzard, and making it very uncomfortable and uneven and dangerous for anyone in a wheelchair or mobility scooter - so much so they have to go in the road. We all have to keep an eye out where walking so we don't trip on them, smaller children fall and cut themselves on the rough edges, and they look dreadful. After 30 years of paying council tax, PLEASE consider getting these fixed, before they get more unsightly and cause a serious problem, and you are faced with a law suit!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitehall Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
2 metal bins containing rubbish and two large cardboard boxes , one full of rubbish. Bins are beginning to smell now as the weather is getting hotter

item.title: Continuous screaming from crackheads taking drugs and displaying anti social behaviour. Has been going on for months. It must be sorted., 17th June
item.description:
There is an ongoing problem with drug taking and anti social behaviour in this alleyway and on the surrounding roads near mare street. The problem occurs every single day and it is completely unacceptable. Betfred and Mungos need to be shut down.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bayford Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green verges on queens mead road long and overgrown and full of weeds, 17th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Private tree growth blocks pedestrian path, 17th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 254-260, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is hazardous human waste, 17th June
item.description:
The homeless people living around the 250 Euston Road building along Euston Road are deficating & urinating outside the building & in the raised planters. This is a public health issue, many of these people have come from oversea & the UCLH homeless team have no recourse to support them. These people are causing a public health nuisance to the users of the building & the general population who work & reside in the area. It is hoped the council can help in clearing & cleaning the area & preventing return from overseas homeless people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Euston Road, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet
